description:
The Salesforce Certified Administrator credential is designed for those who have experience as a Salesforce Administrator. Candidates should possess broad knowledge of Salesforce applications, regularly configure and manage Salesforce, and continuously look for ways their companies can get even more from additional features and capabilities.

Here are some examples of the concepts you should understand to pass the exam:

Manage users, data, and security
Maintain and customize Sales Cloud and Service Cloud applications
Build reports, dashboards, and workflows

name: Salesforce Administrator
subtitle: Salesforce Administrator Certification

episodes.description: The Salesforce Certified Administrator credential is designed for those who have experience as a Salesforce Administrator. Candidates should possess broad knowledge of Salesforce applications, regularly configure and manage Salesforce, and continuously look for ways their companies can get even more from additional features and capabilities. Here are some examples of the concepts you should understand to pass the exam: Manage users, data, and security Maintain and customize Sales Cloud and Service Cloud applications Build reports, dashboards, and workflows
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike Discuss the Salesforce Certified Administrator exam. They go over the exam objectives, and how to prepare for the exam.
episodes.title: Introduction to Salesforce Administrator

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike look at setting up an organization in Salesforce. They also cover the available options when configuring a company profile.
episodes.title: Organization Setup Company Profile

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike demonstrate setting up users in Salesforce. They also cover the options for controlling user access.
episodes.title: User Setup and Security Access

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike demonstrate configuring the Global User Interface in Salesforce. They go over various options that can be configured globally by the Salesforce admin within Classic Salesforce.
episodes.title: Global User Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike discuss the Salesforce sharing model. They explain how to secure the organization and then how to open up visibility using role hierarchy, sharing rules and manual sharing.
episodes.title: Security Access

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike demonstrate using profiles in Salesforce to control access. They look at the built-in profiles as well as ways to clone and modify profiles.
episodes.title: Security Access Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike demonstrate using profiles in Salesforce to control access. They look at the built-in profiles as well as ways to clone and modify profiles.
episodes.title: Lead Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike look at working with accounts and contacts in Salesforce. They go over the standard fields as well as custom fields. They also look at one-to-many and master-detail relationships.
episodes.title: Accounts and Contacts

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike take a look at creating opportunities in Salesforce. They go over both the required and optional fields available when creating an opportunity.
episodes.title: Opportunities

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike continue their look at opportunities in Salesforce. They demonstrate creating opportunity teams and look at defining products within opportunities and using price books.
episodes.title: Opportunities Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike discuss the architecture and relationship model of Salesforce objects. They look at master detail relationships and lookup relationships.
episodes.title: Standard and Custom Objects

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike look at leveraging campaigns in Salesforce. They demonstrate creating campaigns and campaign reports. They also look at target lists and tracking responses.
episodes.title: Campaigns

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike look at service and support in Salesforce. They explain case management, and escalation and assignment rules. They also look at case reports.
episodes.title: Service and Support

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike discuss activities and chatter. They demonstrate tasks and events, and explain the difference between the two. They also discuss Chatter feed and notifications.
episodes.title: Activities and Chatter

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike demonstrate different ways to import, upload and transfer data in Salesforce. They look at data loaders and backing up data.
episodes.title: Data Management and Data Loaders

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike cover reporting in Salesforce. They look at the different types of reports and report formats. They also demonstrate creating a dashboard.
episodes.title: Analytics, Reports and Dashboards

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike demonstrate creating workflows in Salesforce. They look at how workflows can be used to update fields, create tasks, and send messages. They also discuss the approval process.
episodes.title: Workflow Automation

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike explore the Salesforce app exchange. They also look at the Salesforce mobile app, and assigning applications to a group of users.
episodes.title: Mobile and App Exchange
